key_points: Unusually cold temperatures in Texas caused a significant disruption to the state's energy facilities.
Electricity prices in Texas spiked over 10,000% due to increased demand and power outages during the winter storm.
More than 4 million Texans were left without power early in the week of the incident.
Both fossil fuels and renewable energy sources were affected by the Arctic temperatures.
Texas, a leading energy producer in the US, was unprepared for the deep freeze, lacking winterized infrastructure.
Experts highlight Texas' decision to isolate its energy grid as a contributing factor to the crisis.
Citibank accidentally transferred $900 million to Revlon's lenders, losing a legal bid to recover the funds.
McDonald's launched new chicken sandwiches with a promotional $5 swag bundle.
Vegan KitKat bars introduced, offering a plant-based alternative to traditional KitKats.
Bitcoin reached an all-time high above $50,000, benefiting from low-interest rates that weakened the US dollar.
spokespersons: Dan Cohan (Associate Professor of Environmental Engineering, Rice University)
